question.questionText: When switch X was closed and switch Y was open, why was bulb A on?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Bulb A was still contained in the same closed path with the battery.
Bulb A is still contained in a closed path with the battery and switch X.
there is no path containing both switch Y and bulb A
Switch Y and bulb A are not in the same closed path

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: It is on a complete path with the battery
because it was contained in a closed path to the battery.
The battery is conatined in the same path as the bulb.
there was a gap in therefdjkjreajfjhkldec
Bulb a was in a closed path with a battery.
bulb a and switch z are contained in a closed path with a battery
it does not affect bulb a. switch x does affect bulb a. switch x was closed
it was on a closed path and connected to the battery
Bulb A is in the path of switch x.
Bulb A was in a closed circuit.
Bulb A was on because the path was closed from bulb A to the battery.
